text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the official Iraqi press on Saturday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Turkey says there are positive developments toward reopening the Iraqi-Turkish oil pipeline.
- French president attacks Washington trade measures against Iraq, Libya and Cuba.
- Egypt and Turkey stress the importance of maintaining Iraq's unity and sovereignty.
- Police in Baghdad arrest a group of people charged with looting equipment of the national grid.
(The above stories were also carried by QADISSIYA and JUMHOURIYA)
- The U.N. receives a "positive" report on the security of northern Iraq by its mission in Baghdad.
- Culture and Information Minister meets with a French cultural delegation.
- Turkish prime minister signs trade agreement with Egypt.
- Qatar expresses its solidarity with Iraq.
